runs.comm: lunges forward and gives the fuller ball a nod of respect by leaving it outside off
course the next time the same ball comes - full and outside off - Tamim is off and running with a mistimed cover drive
zips through to the wicketkeeper as Sarkar wafts an open face. A simple dab to third man could well have been dangerous. A little bit of a cutter from the left-arm quick
loads up for the front-foot, flat-batted, swat against the short ball outside off and gets it off the very bottom of the bat. Very hollow sound and it doesn't even carry to mid-off
good short ball, good variation. Sarkar goes for a pull but is beaten for pace. And I doubt if he expected it to be that short, and rearing up towards his visor
good length ball outside of,f, pushed into the covers
nicely watched onto the bat as Tamim rides the pace and bounce of the new ball to pick up a single to deep third man
another mistimed swat - the sound was clearly not as meaty as it can be from Sarkar - but he has picked the gap at midwicket. Not short enough for the shot, but he has somehow muscled it away
blunts a back of a length delivery on off stump

beautifully bowled. Looks like the bowlers will have to dig into all their tricks on this pitch. Offcutter, slowed down considerably, it grips into the deck and beats Sarkar's hopeful dab to third man
he looks like he doesn't want to be out there for long. Another cross-batted slog and we are only in the second over. Wanted to bludgeon the ball, but can't even get a feather on it
that's more like it. Climb into the ball that is there to be climbed into. Full and wide outside off, he unfurls a composed cover drive
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
had the opportunity to get under one, what's more it gave Sarkar the chance to free his arms too. Taken full toll of for a boundary to long-on. Firmly hit

top edge! Can anyone get under it? Short fine leg runs back, and deep square leg to his right, but it dribbles away to the fence. Awful choice of shot, and yet the purest display of (misguided) instinct. Saw the ball short and just went for it. Except Vitori had got it to bounce around shoulder height, and kept it outside off stump too. Dragging balls from there to the leg side is never advised.

opens the face and gets a thick outside edge through to deep third man. More intentional than a lucky break though. And there could have been another mix-up between these two. Tamim wanted the second, Sarkar yells no just in time
good length ball angled into off stump, defended
sliced off the open face to deep third man to retain strike
oooh, that was vintage Tamim. Leaps down the track, unconsciously makes room while doing so, and then has a short ball that he can flay through the covers.
oh well done, Muzarabani. He had seen the batsman vacate the crease again and slipped in the offcutter. Tamim has to reach for it and loses all sense of timing. Finds mid-off
full and just outside off, drilled to Cremer at point
beats the man at cover thanks to the sheer strength in the cover drive. And Sean Williams is a good man to have in the ring too
the lack of pace works against him here. Sarkar had picked it up early, gets down low and sends it soaring towards the clouds. Almost a slog sweep to the midwicket boundary
takes a trip down the track and bunts a length ball to mid-on. Wanted to pick that gap to his left, I think
he has swapped ends, but he may have left his better sense behind. Offers up a short ball way down leg side with fine leg inside the circle. Tamim tucks in gleefully with a pull
runs at the bowler, which is why the ball is wider outside off, just enough that the timing is foiled and he picks out the cover fielder
fuller, slower, nice and tight on middle too. Dabbed into the midwicket region. Looked like the legcutter there
that in a nutshell is what Zimbabwe should do. Pull the pace off, keep the line straight and get Bangladesh to do the running. This time Sarkar is reluctant and blocks
leaves the crease again, but he is cramped for room. Good adjustment from the bowler, who allows only a single to long-on
and that in a nutshell is Zimbabwe's problem. Two good balls, then the filthy short one down the leg side and Tamim hammers it over the fine leg fence. Hard, flat, vicious and deserved.
sees the batsman race at him and bowls a good length ball on the pads to prevent from giving any room. Beats the slog, thuds into the back thigh
drilled to mid-off as Tamim scampers outside his crease. No fear from the pace Zimbabwe are summoning

width on offer and Tamim has planted his front leg down and carves it through extra cover. Big gap there so he didn't even bother keeping it down. Muzarabani, quite displeased with this dismissive treatment, glares.
shortish and angled into the pads, Tamim swings across the line and gets an inside edge to short fine leg

offcutter goes straight up and Muzarabani has his redemption. Tamim went down for a lap sweep, but I think he was originally thinking of nudging it through square leg. Seeing the line of the ball stray down leg stump he thought easy runs and changed his shot. Ends up with a top edge that lands into short fine leg's lap
change of pace messes with his line. The offcutter this time meanders way down leg side
good length ball on and around off stump, defended
flighted outside off, Sabbir looks for the push through cover but is not to the pitch of the ball and gets an inside edge
that time it is tossed up and bit more and Sabbir drills it through extra cover
Stays over the wicket to the left-hander presumably to cramp him up. Tossed up on off stump, pushed to long-on
neat footwork as Sabbir jumps back and slots the ball through the gap at midwicket
well bowled Welli! Pulled his length back, but kept his line right to foil Sarkar's gamble to step down the track. Can only tuck it through square leg
the leg side boundary is well protected and that gives him the confidence to place the ball on a good length on middle. Sabbir, new to the crease, hits it along the ground to midwicket
flighted delivery just outside off, the batsman tips it into the covers and sets off
very very slow and though Sarker tried to adjust his bat swing, he is unable to connect a flick with a good length ball on leg stump
a touch quicker on middle and leg, Sarkar is slow on it this time and gets an inside edge onto pad
dreadful ball, and Sarkar makes sure it is banished to the square leg boundary. Set up a good base on the back foot and pulled it so hard
tossed up on leg stump, swept to short fine leg
another iffy delivery from the leggie - a low full toss outside leg - swept away to backward square leg on the boundary
another short ball, but since it's rather quick, Sarkar has mistimed the pull. Only a single to deep square leg
tossed up on leg stump, nudged through midwicket, which is so vacant that the bowler himself has to run around

oooh, beautiful footwork! Made sure he didn't reveal his intentions too early. Came down the track only after the ball left Masakadza's fingers, and takes full toll of the flight on it. Launched over wide long-on
and there's the overcorrection, which Sarkar was waiting for.  Camped back deep in his crease and shows he can pull off the most delicate late cut too
worked behind square, but he can't beat the short fine leg

good choice of shot - it was a short ball down leg side - so Sarkar went down on one knee and plays the lap sweep. A little more bat on it and he could well have beaten Hami M at short fine leg. Speaking of which, when was the last time you saw a captain at that fielding position?
gets a short ball, but cuts it straight to cover. Admonishes himself for that
flatter on off stump, Sabbir jumps back and cuts to the left of that man at cover. Misfield gives away a single
flighted down the leg side, Sarkar can't connect with a fine sweep and has to settle for a wide
tossed up on off stump, defended

eesh, that's a terrible lapse from Sarkar. Shakes his head as he walks off, and this is all on him. Came down the track, got to the pitch of a legspinner on leg stump and he could have had a six for the taking. Instead he picks out the man at deep midwicket. Easy catch for Waller
held it back just a bit, and gave it a good rip too. Kisses the deck and skids onto the batsman, who inside edges it onto his pad
eased through the covers as Mahmudullah is able to display better movement of the front foot

sharp catch! Well done, Mutumbami! This was nowhere near short enough to cut, but that's almost the only shot Mahmudullah left himself after moving so early and so far to the leg side. Flashing bat comes down, the under-edge is take, and Mutumbami who was just getting up from his crouch manages to hold on to it with both hands.
flighted on off stump, defended into the covers and the fielder swoops down on it quickly. Zimbabwe have certainly got the boost they needed
goes for the sweep as he sees the flight on the ball and it tailing down leg. Struck on the boot on the full, but it would have gone down leg
tapped to his right at midwicket and sets off for a quick single. Wellington M does well to chase it down himself and even attempt a run out at the non-strikers'
careful batting, good batting from Sabbir as he takes advantage of the vacancies in the leg side infield. Single to square leg
driven to long-on to retain strike
gets down low to pull a flatter ball from outside off stump to long-on
that time he goes for the more orthodox shot to a flat delivery outside off - the cut to the sweeper cover

dropped by Mutumbami, and this was a seriously sharp one too! Cremer slips in the loopy legspinner and its slower pace deceives Sabbir into playing across the line. Goes for the flick to midwicket because the line of the ball was on middle, but it turns, bounces, takes the outside edge and deviates too far for the wicketkeeper
whipped away to deep midwicket and manages a couple of runs. Good batting that time, jumped back against the flatter ball and hit the gap
now he's down the track to exploit the gap to the right of long-on
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
flatter and just outside off, Sabbir moves beside it and slices to point
speared in on middle, Sabbir moves forward and plays around his front pad. Gets an inside edge which helps him avoid the lbw appeal
top work from the former captain! Picked up the flatter quicker delivery so early and thumps it away to the third man boundary with a reverse sweep. All he did was used the pace of the bowler
oooh, lovely batting again. Races down the pitch to lift another dart on middle through extra cover. Riskfree, productive.
and now for the lap sweep because he saw the ball pushed through down leg

lovely placement from Mushfiqur. Waits on the short ball outside off a tad more and then plants the open face down on nice and late to make sure he beats the deep point fielder. Could have gotten a boundary, but that man was rather quick getting across

Ooh, Zimbabwe. You can't be making silly mistakes like that. Mushfiq had run down the track, but mistimed a swat into the covers. Slower ball had worked to get them a dot, but the fielder rushing in could not the ball in his hands and ends up kicking it away to the leg side
Takes a length ball and thumps it over the straight boundary. Admires the considerable hang time on the ball as it soars away

well done, Madziva! Slips in the back of the hand slower ball having seen Sabbir set up for the scoop over his left shoulder - moved across, feet apart, bat in the form of a shovel. In the end he has to block it into the covers
good, strong pull from the batsman having read the lack of flight and set himself deep in his crease. Mushy wants a second, looks risky, but he puts in the big dive and makes sure he reaches in time
Loads of flight, no real pace, Sabbir looks to make his own with a big sweep and mistimes it to square leg
A tad shorter and Mushfiqur camps back and pulls to deep midwicket

Yikes, he saw Sabbir racing down the pitch and shortened his length. The only problem was he had basically had dug it to the middle of the pitch and it just sat up for Sabbir to hammer over the midwicket boundary
Tossed up just outside off, nudged into the midwicket region for a quick single
Slower through the air on off stump, goes for the reverse sweep but it was a touch too full
backs away and slices the fuller ball from middle stump to deep point
how has that missed the off stump! Oh, because it had hit his front pad while Mushy was attempting a reverse sweep. Again chose the wrong ball because it was slower through the air
stays leg side and pats a fuller ball through point
Down the track, loves the width on offer and launches it with a free swing of the arms. Soars beyond the long-on boundary
flighted on middle, turned away to deep square leg and Williams keeps it a single

gets down the track and knocks it down to long-on. They scamper across for a couple, which brings the fifty partnership, but it seems like trouble is around the corner. Mushfiqur has pulled up midway through the second run. Looks like his right hamstring is cramping up
made room for himself, but Cremer pushes it through quick on middle stump. Mistimed cut to point. And oh dear, Mushfiqur is cramping up badly again
full and angled into the left-hander, Shakib clips it gently and with the midwicket deep, he can get across for the second. That's too easy.

another little nudge into the midwicket region, but the man had been brought up and funnily enough the two is still on offer. Williams swooped down on the ball and attempted a shy at the bowlers' end, but ends up giving away an overthrow

backs away, Vitori looks for the toe-crusher but gets a low full toss. Shakib slices it straight to point, and still gets a run because of another mistake in the field. Went right through the man there
looks for the scoop again, but the yorker slips under his bat and between his legs to the keeper. Mutumbami underamed a needless throw at the stumps and Shakib is alert to the single
nearly a yorker on middle, Shakib makes room and slices it through to deep cover. Well bowled, well played

finally he gets the shovel sweep to work. Moved his back leg outside off, his front leg opened up outside leg, the grip on his bat changed to flick the ball over his left shoulder. Full toss from the bowler helped, of course.
looks for the wide yorker, but he toes the line on the wrong side as Shakib leaves it well
finds the block hole just outside off, Shakib drills it through the covers
beautifully bowled. Took all the pace off the ball, but still managed to keep it full and straight. Sabbir also did well to turn it to short fine leg
that's a sublime hit from Shakib! He knows the bowler will be going for the yorker, so he camps back in his crease, clears his hips and thumps the ball down the ground
slower, and fuller on leg, swiped to short fine leg

back of the hand slower ball wide outside off stump, Sabbir looks to belt it through the covers but ends up with an inside edge into the midwicket region. The unmanned midwicket region so Bangladesh take two, even as the poor bowler runs across and fields it himself
beaten on the legcutter outside off, Sabbir had nearly wrapped up his slog across the line by the time the ball came to him
leans forward and across to connect with a low full toss and deflect it towards short fine leg

goes for the dilscoop again, but his efficiency with that shot has been rather comical tonight. I can remember him connecting only once. And the thinking behind that shot needs more work, with the bowler taking all the pace off the ball
well bowled! Vitori goes for the slower short ball having seen the batsman charge at him. Shakib had set up and executed the pull a full two seconds before it comes and hits him on the neck
oh, why would he go for his normal pace delivery when the slower ones were working so well? Shakib says thank you very much with a vicious swipe to the midwicket boundary
nice and full, Shakib drags it to long-on and Sabbir, who has been at the crease for a majority of the innings has enough stamina to make a second run. Great work from Bangladesh
the yorker tails into Shakib's pads, he manages to knock it down to long-on and there seems two on offer again, but Shakib has slipped at the non-strikers' end
beats him with the offcutter, slanted across the left-hander. Shakib, in full slogging mode, swings across the line and misses
goes round arm now and manages to keep it full and straight. Shakib, goes for a heave over the leg side but has been surprised by the change in action. Dot down the pitch
three in a row from Muzarabani! Take a bowl. This is a slower ball just outside off, Shakib had jumped across and looks for the sweep because fine leg is up. No connection

fourth time lucky and how! That time the yorker doesn't quite land in the tiny little space by the batsman's boot and Shakib has just flicked it from his presence. How much power does he have in his wrists?
fuller and just outside off, slapped to long-off

legcutter on middle stump, turned into a yorker as Sabbir races down the track. Looks only a single down the ground, but it is the last ball, there is no downside to being greedy now. Bangladesh go for the second run, and they get it because the bowler doesn't take the throw and misses an easy run out chance
